title: Forks (Two Targets)
coachIntro: One move, two problems. That is a fork.
summary: Learn to attack two pieces at once with Knights, pawns, Queens, and when to choose a fork over a simple capture.

tasks.prompt: Your Knight can attack the King and Queen at the same time. Find the fork move.
tasks.successMessage: Excellent. One jump, two problems. Always ask: 'Can my Knight fork the King and a heavy piece?'

tasks.prompt: Your Knight can attack the King and Rook together. Jump to the square that hits both.
tasks.successMessage: Good. A Knight fork on King and Rook is a small tactical jackpot.

tasks.prompt: Push your pawn so that it attacks two enemy pieces at once.
tasks.successMessage: Beautiful. The smallest soldier can still demand respect when he attacks two officers.

tasks.prompt: Your Queen can give check and attack a loose piece at the same time. Find the fork.
tasks.successMessage: Good. The Queen is strongest when she attacks in more than one direction.

tasks.prompt: You can win something nowâ€¦ or much more next move. Find the move that creates the strongest fork.
tasks.successMessage: Correct. Do not grab the first apple you see when there is an entire orchard waiting.
